descr: "The resource ChargeItem describes the provision of healthcare provider products for a certain patient, therefore referring not only to the product, but containing in addition details of the provision, like date, time, amounts and participating organizations and persons. Main Usage of the ChargeItem is to enable the billing process and internal cost allocation."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a ChargeItem resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Identifiers assigned to this event performer or other systems."

fields.name: definition
fields.descr: "References the source of pricing information, rules of application for the code this ChargeItem uses."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "The current state of the ChargeItem."

fields.name: partOf
fields.descr: "ChargeItems can be grouped to larger ChargeItems covering the whole set."

fields.name: code
fields.descr: "A code that identifies the charge, like a billing code."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "The individual or set of individuals the action is being or was performed on."

fields.name: context
fields.descr: "The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this event."

fields.name: occurrenceDateTime
fields.descr: "Date/time(s) or duration when the charged service was applied."

fields.name: occurrencePeriod
fields.descr: "Date/time(s) or duration when the charged service was applied."

fields.name: occurrenceTiming
fields.descr: "Date/time(s) or duration when the charged service was applied."

fields.name: participant
fields.descr: "Indicates who or what performed or participated in the charged service."

fields.name: performingOrganization
fields.descr: "The organization requesting the service."

fields.name: requestingOrganization
fields.descr: "The organization performing the service."

fields.name: quantity
fields.descr: "Quantity of which the charge item has been serviced."

fields.name: bodysite
fields.descr: "The anatomical location where the related service has been applied."

fields.name: factorOverride
fields.descr: "Factor overriding the factor determined by the rules associated with the code."

fields.name: priceOverride
fields.descr: "Total price of the charge overriding the list price associated with the code."

fields.name: overrideReason
fields.descr: "If the list price or the rule based factor associated with the code is overridden, this attribute can capture a text to indicate the  reason for this action."

fields.name: enterer
fields.descr: "The device, practitioner, etc. who entered the charge item."

fields.name: enteredDate
fields.descr: "Date the charge item was entered."

fields.name: reason
fields.descr: "Describes why the event occurred in coded or textual form."

fields.name: service
fields.descr: "Indicated the rendered service that caused this charge."

fields.name: account
fields.descr: "Account into which this ChargeItems belongs."

fields.name: note
fields.descr: "Comments made about the event by the performer, subject or other participants."

fields.name: supportingInformation
fields.descr: "Further information supporting the this charge."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."

"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."

fields.descr:

searches.name: entereddate
searches.descr: Date the charge item was entered

searches.name: occurrence
searches.descr: When the charged service was applied

searches.name: participantrole
searches.descr: What type of performance was done
